flashcards.english: Caria Mwangi (look for Mwangi), Caria mbeca (look for money), Caria mahĩtia (look for errors/mistakes)
flashcards.notes: Verb 'Caria' (search) with example usage. Shows versatility: searching for people (Mwangi), objects (mbeca/money), or abstract concepts (mahĩtia/errors)

flashcards.english: Gũcaria (to search), Gũcoka (to return/come back-person), Gũcokia (to return-object), Gũĩka (to do), Gũikara (to stay), Gũikara thĩ (to sit down), Gũikena (to be happy), Gũkinya (to arrive/step on), Gũthambia (to wash), Gũthĩĩ rũgendo (to go on journey), Gũthũkia (to damage/spoil), Gũtigara (to remain), Gũtinia (to cut), Gweterera (to wait), Gwĩcĩrĩria (to think/reason), Kũgeria (to try)
flashcards.notes: 16 essential verbs you should know. Note distinction: Gũcoka (person returns) vs Gũcokia (return an object). Gũikara = stay, Gũikara thĩ = sit down (literally: stay on ground)

flashcards.english: Ritho/Maitho (eye/eyes), Mũtwe/Mĩtwe (head/heads), Mũkangi/Mĩkangi (beak/beaks), Ngingo (neck), Ĩthagu/Mathagu (wings), Ruoya/Njoya (feather/feathers), Mwĩrĩ/Mĩrĩ (body/bodies), Njoya cia Kĩngũĩ (tail feathers), Kũgũrũ/Magũrũ (leg/legs)
flashcards.notes: Complete bird anatomy with singular/plural forms. Cĩĩga cia nyoni = parts of a bird. Note: Kĩngũĩ = tail, so njoya cia kĩngũĩ = feathers of tail
